page.title: 03THORNBURY THEN AND NOW 2
page.content: 9. Riddifords (Grocers) is the least changed shop. It still delivers for its customers. 10. The first car, 1906 was owned by a Dr Salmon. 11. Girl's school uniform used to be gym slips, black stockings, laced boots. Now no special uniform in most junior schools. At the Castle Secondary School the girls wear navy blue skirts and cardigans, the boys grey trousers, grey shirts and a blue and yellow striped tie. 12. A ducking stool was kept in the goal which is now Worthingtons (clothing shop). 13. The population in the country area around Oldbury has remained the same for at least 300 yr. Even though there are more houses the family sizes are smaller.
